content: Management of the condition has evolved over time and there has been a therapeutic paradigm shift away from concentrating solely on prevention of AF recurrence towards ventricular rate control, based on so-called “rate versus rhythm control” randomized trials conducted >2 decades ago.5-8 With the more recent development of targeted therapies aimed specifically at restoration and maintenance of sinus rhythm with antiarrhythmic drugs (AADs) and left atrial ablation, it became necessary to re-assess their impact on major adverse cardiovascular outcomes, such as death, stroke, systemic embolism, or progression of heart failure, as well as AF recurrence and quality of life (QoL)
query: atrial fibrillation recurrence rates maintenance therapy amiodarone beta-blockers long-term outcomes rhythm maintenance
title: The Increasing Role of Rhythm Control in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation: JACC State-of-the-Art Review
authors: A. John Camm, Gerald V. Naccarelli, Suneet Mittal, Harry J.G.M. Crijns, Stefan H. Hohnloser, Chang-Sheng Ma, Andrea Natale, Mintu P. Turakhia, Paulus Kirchhof
reference: Camm, A. J., Naccarelli, G. V., Mittal, S., Crijns, H. J. G. M., Hohnloser, S. H., Ma, C.-S., Natale, A., Turakhia, M. P., & Kirchhof, P. (2022). The increasing role of rhythm control in patients with atrial fibrillation: JACC state-of-the-art review. JACC, 79(19). https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jacc.2022.03.345
